channel.title: How To Make An Egg Sandwich w/o Dirtying A Pan!
channel.description:
[center]OK first of all, an egg sandwich is a sandwich(duh) with cooked eggs instead of meat. [/center]
[center][u][b]Things Needed[/b][/u]
Eggs{as many as you want(2 recommended)} Plastic Ziploc bag(1) Bread(2 Slices) Knife Fork(optional) Butter(optional) Salt(optional) [img]http://i96.photobucket.com/albums/l190/bloodrayne93/PICT0002.jpg[/img][/center]
[center][u][b]Procedure[/b][/u]
1. Crack both eggs into the Ziploc bag
2. Shake, pound(make sure not to break bag), mix eggs in bag
3. Add water or milk to make eggs fluffier(optional)
4. Put the bag into the microwave(make sure the bag is open a little to prevent explosion :P)
5. Set microwave for 1:50 seconds(works on mine, your settings may vary) and press "Start"
6. Put two pieces of bread into the toaster oven(toasting is optional)
7. When egg is finished in microwave, take out and wait for toast to toast
8. Put butter on the toast(optional) and then slide the egg onto the toast
9. Put the other piece of bread on top of the egg which is on top of the bread
10. Add salt(optional) [/center]
[center]And there you have it, a perfect egg sandwich... And you didnt have to dirty any pan! Cool huh? [img]http://i96.photobucket.com/albums/l190/bloodrayne93/1eggysand.jpg[/img]
[tt]Made by TaylorCo 2006 all rights reserved. If reused, credit goes to "BloodRayne at moparisthebest.com"[/tt][/center]

item.title: How To Make An Egg Sandwich w/o Dirtying A Pan!
item.dc:creator: @l3etal3lade l3etal3lade
item.description:
@l3etal3lade wrote:

This is a pretty nifty concept except for one minute detail, theirs certain types of plastics that are obviously not safe for microwave use and will leech into your food, also if you want to make a hard boiled egg without a stove you can take an egg CAREFULLY without fully breaking the egg puncture a small hole into it for release of air pop this into a bowl of water and put in the microwave, some of the egg will leak out into the water, but you can tell when the egg is done because of this as well, I haven’t used this since I was a kid so I have no pics to show but its pretty simple. And obvious when the egg is done. < Just something fairly relevant I thought I’d share.

Read full topic

item.title: How To Make An Egg Sandwich w/o Dirtying A Pan!
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

TBH get a plastic jug/pot. Put 2 eggs in it, add milk and whisk. Then put in microwave for ~2 mins. Take them out, add a little bit of butter and mix them up again. keep cooking until nearly all liquid is gone. Then remove and mix and serve.

Read full topic

item.title: How To Make An Egg Sandwich w/o Dirtying A Pan!
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

cumescape:

That takes way to long.

Actually much quicker than frying the eggs.

They are a little dry though. Normally I butter a pan and fry them in that, which tastes pretty epic. I have a feeling just putting butter on the eggs after microwaving them won’t be the same.

Btw, you’re my savior. My parents threw away our frying pan a few months ago and my dad bought all these expensive black pans. Except you have to clean them in a really weird way which means when I cook eggs on it, they taste weird already and then they taste like whatever was cooked on it last too. I haven’t eaten eggs in a while.

Read full topic
